fields.description:
h4. Problem Description
Currently the REST API documentation has an example plugin called {{rest-oauth-client-1.0.one-jar.jar}} to demonstrate using OAuth to authenticate against JIRA's REST service.
Link: https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/jira-rest-apis/jira-rest-api-tutorials/jira-rest-api-example-oauth-authentication

However, this plugin has not been updated for a long time, and at the moment suffers from SNI errors when JIRA is running behind SSL NGinX with SNI:
{code}
java -jar rest-oauth-client-1.0.one-jar.jar requestToken https://my-jira-url 
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
at com.simontuffs.onejar.Boot.run(Boot.java:340)
at com.simontuffs.onejar.Boot.main(Boot.java:166)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to obtain request token
at com.atlassian.oauth.client.example.AtlassianOAuthClient.getRequestToken(AtlassianOAuthClient.java:66)
at com.atlassian.oauth.client.example.JIRAOAuthClient.main(JIRAOAuthClient.java:52)
... 6 more
Caused by: javax.net.ssl.SSLException: hostname in certificate didn't match: <my-jira-url> != <url1> OR <url2> OR <url3>
at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier.verify(AbstractVerifier.java:222)
at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.BrowserCompatHostnameVerifier.verify(BrowserCompatHostnameVerifier.java:54)
at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier.verify(AbstractVerifier.java:151)
at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier.verify(AbstractVerifier.java:131)
at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLSocketFactory.connectSocket(SSLSocketFactory.java:326)
{code}
This is because the plugin is using an outdated version of the HTTPClient library, {{httpclient-4.0-beta2.jar}}
SNI bug is fixed in httpclient 4.5.3: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1726 

h4. Solution
Update the plugin to use the newer version of the httpclient library, e.g. 4.5.3. 

h4. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Update rest-oauth-client plugin in the REST API OAuth Authentication documentation to use newer version of HTTPClient library
It should be possible to log work by end date.

h3. Summary

Columns order changed by JIRA randomly for newly saved filter.
h3. Steps to reproduce:

1. Run an already saved filter
 2. Add new column and Save As with a new name.
 3. Make sure the columns set is "Filter" (not My Defaults nor System).
 4. Add a column.

Check attached video.
h3. Expected results:

The selected column gets added to the end.
h3. Actual results:

One of two things happens:
 1. The selected column is inserted in the middle, and some shifting /shuffling of other columns happens (e.g., the left half of columns get approximately swapped with the right half of columns.
 OR
 2. All other columns are removed, and only the added column remains.
fields.summary: Columns order changed by JIRA randomly for newly saved filter

h3. Summary
In the JIRA Mobile version, clicking on collapsed comments in JIRA to expand the individual comment does not respond. Confirmed on both Android and iOS.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud 1000.148.3 (not available in list of versions)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a JIRA issue, ensure there is a long comment that will be reduced to 1 line
# On your mobile device, navigate to that issue in your browser.
# You'll see you can expand the physical list of comments, but not the individual comments that have been cut down to 1 line.

h3. Expected Results
The comment should expand. I also expected to be able to click on the comment in order to edit it or take any action on it.

h3. Actual Results
Clicking has no effect, almost as if it's not a clickable area.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround other than reverting to JIRA iOS app, or changing to Desktop Mode
fields.summary: Individual collapsed comments cannot be expanded in mobile version

{panel:title=Summary|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}

h3. Summary
 
The JQL query field "updated" and "updatedDate is a duplication within the Issue Navigator feature. Both query will produce the same result when queried. Would be great if this feature could be used more effectively and simplify the usage so that both behaves according nature of its name and the ultimate aim is to sanitise JIRA's Dates (make them consistent) across the product, plus simplify reporting.
 
h3. How to Replicate
 
# Go to Issue Navigator
# Switch to advanced navigation search using JQL
# Key in "updated >= 2016-07-13"
# Key in "updatedDate >= 2016-07-13" will get the same result as above ^
 
h3. Actual Result

* Both "updated >= 2016-07-13" and "updatedDate >= 2016-07-13" shows the Date and Time component on the Last Updated column.

h3. Expected Result

* "updated >= 2016-07-13" should show the Date and Time component
*  "updatedDate >= 2016-07-13" should on shows the Date component in the Last Updated column.

h3. Instance Details
 
* Any instance with JIRA are able to replicate the issue.
 
h3. Investigation Done
 
* queried "updated = 2016-07-13" and  "updatedDate = 2016-07-13" will produce the same result.
* Asked developers regarding this behaviour. As stated by them, SystemSearchConstants.UPDATE_DATE defines two clause names for the same field which are "updated" and "updatedDate". The duplication exists for consistency with createdDate and resolutionDate. Also mentioned that it is very difficult to remove JQL, as it ends up being stored in the database. E.g. when you save a filter, that JQL is then stored in the database.

h3. Suggestion

Segregate "updatedDate" with "updated" clause names from SystemSearchConstants.UPDATE_DATE as this would be consistent with the query field names and expecting the followings results:

# querying updatedDate JQL field will show the result of *Date only*, only looking at the date component and ignoring the time component.
# querying update JQL field will show the result of *Date AND Time*, In other words, would look at both components, the date and the time.

{panel}
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Issues Navigator JQL to query for date-time (using update) or date only (using updateDate)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61874].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Summary|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}

h3. Summary

On JIRA Issues Navigator, we are unable to query the *exact* update/updateDate date to show result of one day, instead we would be required to specify *time range*. 


h3. How to Replicate
 
# Go to Issue Navigator.
# Switch to advanced navigation search using JQL.
# Key in "updated = 2016-07-13" and Enter <-- will not get any result.
# Key in "updated >= 2016-07-13 AND updated < 2016-07-14" and Enter <-- will get result within the specified range.

h3. Actual Results

* Key in "updated = 2016-07-13" will not generate any result


h3. Expectation

* Key in "updated = 2016-07-13" will generate list of result for this day.

h3. Workaround

* To show the result for one day, we'll need to query: "updated >= 2016-07-13 AND updated < 2016-07-14".

h3. Instance Details
 
* Any instance with JIRA are able to replicate the issue.
 
h3. Investigation Done
 
* Tested the query and no result are found if exact date are queried.
 
h3. Please Help With
 
* Changed the filter behavior to include the query for the exact date besides having to specify range of date. This will simplify the usage so that non technical/developers can understand.

{panel}
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Issues Navigator to query for exact day instead of time range

h3. Summary

When assigning a screen to the 'View' operation for an issue type, you are given the option to add or remove the description field from the field configuration. As 'Description' is not a field that can be hidden from 'View', only 'Create' and 'Edit', it can cause confusion for users who would like to remove Description from the issue view entirely.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove the 'Description' field from the field configuration of the 'View' operation for an issue type in a project.

h3. Expected Results

Description should be hidden from the issue view, or it shouldn't be a field option for the 'View' operation.

h3. Actual Results

Description will still be in the issue view.
fields.summary: Cannot hide Description from View Page

Hello Atlassian,

If this is already a feature then please disregard, but it would be a nice ability to tie Atlasssian's online support documentation into the search resources of a companies JIRA/Confluence tools.  In order to allow for security compliance it could be a checkbox (default off) so that installations did not need to worry about the system attempting to fetch remote assets, but if this was not a concern it would be nice to not have to leave JIRA/Confluence to benefit from Atlassian documentation.

Regards,
Scott Gilliland

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61871].
  {panel}

h3. Description
When a issue is assigned to a user, the history tab record the user display name and user_key. As a result, when the user changed the username, JIRA issue history tab will still be showing user_key.

h3. Step to reproduce
# Create a user(lets say 'test') and using the user, perform certain actions on any issue (like adding issue links, comments etc)
# Notice that the issue history tab shows changes made by this user 'test'.
# Now rename this user from administration console giving it a new username (say 'testabc').
# Now make some more changes to the issue using this renamed user.
# Now go to the history tab and notice that the old username 'test' is still being used. The new username 'testabc' is never used in the history tab.

h3. Suggestion
* Instead of using user_key (which is not editable via UI, issue's history tab should show *username* instead, as it's more relevant to the users.
fields.summary: Improvement to show username instead of user_key in issue's history tab

h3. Summary:

Issue description with colon (: ) does not work in quick search. If the *colon* *:* is added to the search string, it works.
The Quick search does not work with numeric search.

h3. Environment:
JIRA 7.1.7
PostgresSQL
Version 51.0.2704.103 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to reproduce:

* Create a ticket with the description {{Test : ACIS2016-00359}}
* Go to the quicksearch textbox and look for *ACIS2016-00359* without the colon and it will throw the below error:
**  !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 16.37.50.png|thumbnail! 
* However, if you search with the colon {{: ACIS2016-00359}}, it returns the expected result as below:
**  !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 16.39.13.png|thumbnail! 

* Numeric search:
*  !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 18.03.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* There is no workaround as such, the user needs to include the colon with the search or user JQL search instead.

h3. Observations:

* There is no issue with other special characters such as *(* . It works as documented (that is to escape it) or we can search without it and it returns the result
*  !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 16.42.52.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Colon (:) does not work in Quick search.

h3. PROBLEM:

Non licensed users synced from LDAP (without any group membership and application access) are showing in the User picker field _Assignee_ when the _Assignable Issue_ permission is configured to _Any Logged in User_.

h3. STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
# Connect JIRA to LDAP and synchronise
!user.png|thumbnail!
# Ensure that the _Assignable Issue_ permission is set to _Any Logged in User_.
!permission.png|thumbnail!
# Go to _Assignee_ field and start typing the username of a user synced from LDAP without any application access and group membership
!assign.png|thumbnail!


h3. EXPECTED RESULT:
Even the Assignable issue permission is set to Any Logged in user, it shouldn't show users who don't have any group membership or application access as in any way, he won't be able to login to JIRA.

h3. ACTUAL RESULT:
User without any means of logging in to JIRA is showing on the User picker field

h4. Work Around

None.
fields.summary: Application Role "Any Logged in User" displays Users who don't have any Group Membership or Application Access

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61850].
  {panel}

We wanted to migrate our project to our own JIRA instance. The original JIRA was running 6.0.8 we wanted to move to the latest 7.x.

Created a back up, but during import it had version miss match.

Downloaded 6.0.8 hope that I can import the project there and upgrade to 7. Failed with a field error message. No detail what I should do, what is the error.

So decided use the Issue export button. Funny that you export issues into format, which your product doesn't support. Anyway I had a go with Excel. Generated 14mb size file. Import error: File larger than 10MB. Oh my gosh!!! It is 2016 and the file is larger than 10Mb.

Created another export dropping the tickets, which are closed. File size: 7mb. Let's start importing it at 12pm on Friday.
Stupid question about there is a field, which he doesn't know where to map, but until I don't map it to the summary field I cannot press Next. Wonder why the choice than. Hurray Import begins... There is 148 error or warning... no detail probably because your product has no idea as well that is why it is either error or warning. It is a thing.

Any way... progress bar moves slowly... 7pm time to go home! Progress bar is 28%... Maybe it finishes on the weekend? Come in to the office. 10 am. Progress bar is at 52%.

Nice. 7mb 48 hour still not completed. Could you please share me that algorithm because I just cannot figure out what kind of algorithm parse 50% of 7mb in 48 hour on intel core i8.

Any way. I believe it is safe to assume your product cannot import/export its own data?
fields.summary: JIRA migration process is a catastrophe

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61845].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
If a transition is associated with a screen, when the screen pops up, it's not possible to review the information in the background screen (usually View Issue screen) any more. If one is not ready to transition the issue, he/she has to cancel the screen, review the information in the background screen, then click the transition button and fill in all the fields again. This is inconvenient.

h4. +Suggestion+
The pop-up screen should be made non-modal, so that users can move it out of the view of the background screen and work on both simultaneously.
  
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – Jul 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for filing, voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.
 
I understand the modal dialog here can be cumbersome. Generally, making it non-modal and/or draggable is a great suggestion. Currently we don't have any work scheduled on this and cannot provide an estimate on when an improvement would be delivered. We will be looking into how we can improve screen dialogs soon, including transition use cases.
 
Regards,
Daniel Franz
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
fields.summary: Pop-up (transition) screens should be non-modal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61844].
  {panel}

Many users in our group have the Autowatch feature enabled, to get informed about new issues being submitted.
The usage of jira increased a lot (which is good, i guess), which made the number of emails each user receives unmanagable in the daily email flood without mailfilters.
And here we are stuck a bit in writing mail filters which separate jira mails which are due to the autowatch feature, from those emails which are received because one is on the watch list of an issue or because an issue is assigned to the user.
usually i would expect to set the mail filter on the "To:" field in the header (autowatch would go to "watcher-mailinglist@foobar.baz" and watchlist and assignees go to "actual_user@bar.baz")
But any other scriptable distinguisher (e.g. topic having [autowatch]) would be fine as well.
fields.summary: make jira notification emails distinguishable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition

The Filter Results Gadget wraps test in long description fields and as a result text content can span multiple lines with long descriptions. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide additional functionality to control the gadget's layout such as wrap text option, or truncate text.

h3. Workaround
Workaround options include:
- Use a wider column layout for the dashboard. 
- Keep the filter results gadget columns to a minimum.
- Include a JavaScript in your JIRA Announcement banner that locates the affected strings through the JavaScript document object model, and truncate them using Javascript. 
- Use the [Gadget Development Guides|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/GADGETS/Gadget+Developer+Documentation] to implement a specialised gadget for your needs.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian update as of November 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
We are happy to announce that starting from Jira 8.21 the ‘Statistic type’, ‘X axis’, and ‘Y axis’ fields in the configuration of the following gadgets have the autocompletion and the choices are sorted alphabetically: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics, Pie Chart, and Issue Statistics.

We are considering to backport the fix to Jira 8.20 LTS after so called soaking time on Jira 8.21.

Kind regards,
Jira DC Team
{panel}

h3. Summary

When configuring a Pie Chart, users can select a *Statistic Type*. This loads a list of fields and custom fields which can be used. Custom fields are *not* sorted alphabetically. This makes it hard to locate a particular Custom Field especially if we have 100s.
 * This same behavior is present in the XAxis and YAxis select lists that appear when configuring the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget

If this is intended, this is not convenient and should be reverted back to alphabetical order.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7 (tested in 7.1.8)
 # Create several Custom Fields (this is what I created)
 ** !7cf.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a new dashboard and add the Pie Chart Gadget
 # Configure the gadget to select a _Statistic Type_

h3. Expected Results
 # Custom fields are sorted alphabetically

h3. Actual Results
 # Custom fields are *NOT* sorted alphabetically
 !7pc.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
After giving the focus to the select list for the _Static type,_ the user can write the name (or the initial letters) of the custom field they are looking for and the selection will move to the option matching the typed letter/combination. If a letter is pressed, after selection jumps to the first option matching the letter typed, the procedure can be repeated.
Example 1: let's say you have 10 custom fields that start with "A", click in the select/combo  and press the letter "A" once, the option selected will change to the next occurrence of "A" in the list, if it is not the desired one, repeat the process until the option desired is found.
Example 2: let's say you have 1,000 custom fields that start with "A", something like "Aftercredit scenes are staple of Marvel movies". to search for this, click in the select/combo field of the gadget and type "After", if the next option in the list after the currently selected option is the custom field you want, it will be selected, if not, repeat the process or type a more approximated combination.
fields.summary: Custom Field not sorted alphabetically when configuring Statistic Type or Axis in gadgets

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian update as of November 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
We are happy to announce that starting from Jira 8.21 the ‘Statistic type’, ‘X axis’, and ‘Y axis’ fields in the configuration of the following gadgets have the autocompletion and the choices are sorted alphabetically: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics, Pie Chart, and Issue Statistics.

We are considering to backport the fix to Jira 8.20 LTS after so called soaking time on Jira 8.21.

Kind regards,
Jira DC Team
{panel}

h3. Summary
Some gadgets require users to configure "Statistic Type" which consists of various fields available in JIRA (eg. Assignee, Fix Version, etc). When configuring this, the fields are not ordered alphabetically which makes it hard to locate some field especially if this is a long list
!order.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggestion
Sort this alphabetically

h3. Note
_Statistic Type_ is just one example. I'm not sure if there are other configurations behaving the same as well.
fields.summary: Order Gadgets Configuration Alphabetically

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61805].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When sending E-mails into JIRA Service Desk, which includes content of configuration files, JIRA will often render it in strange ways.

This is important for customers who's use-case involves supporting a technical product that might involve communicating technical information

h3. Suggested Solution
Attempt to identify if text within E-mails is coding syntax and automatically render it as such. 

h3. Workaround
- Edit the description and wrap the config file in the tag: {{\{noformat\}}} at the start and end of the syntax specific text as that should help show a more sensible format, or escape the syntax manually using back slashes. 
- Configure [field renderers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-renderers-802592570.html] to prevent JIRA styling the text as another workaround.
fields.summary: Smart Syntax detection for Incomming Service Desk E-mails

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Due to JIRA not being able to handle 4 byte characters when using MySQL (JRA-36135), emails which contains 4 byte characters will fail to be created. However JIRA keeps on trying to process the email and each time it does, {{issuenum}} will increase by 1 although a ticket is never really created

h3. Suggestion
Avoid this from happening. Some suggestions are
# Either stop processing kind of mail the moment it fails once to avoid issue number from increasing OR
# Change the process such that it will only increment {{issuenum}} when an issue is successfully created

h3. Temporary Workaround
Remove the email containing the 4 byte character by either moving it to another folder or deleting it.

h3. Permanent  Workaround
See JRA-36135 - upgrade to Jira 8 or modify the database
fields.summary: Change the handling behavior of emails containing 4 byte characters to avoid random increments of issue numbers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The 2.1.12 instance health plugin adds a check for the presence of jira-healthcheck-eol.json in your jira home directory to check EOL date. If that file is not present on the system and the system cannot reach the marketplacet to check EOL the health check plugin will not run and will throw an error of 'there was an error performing the instance health check' in the GUI.

!health_error.JPG|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the 2.1.12 instance health plugin
 # Check that jira-healthcheck-eol.json does not exist in JIRA_HOME
 # remove the ability of the system to connect to the marketplace
 # Check the instance health tab in JIRA

h3. Expected Results

That you can run the instance health check if JIRA does not have connectivity to the internet/marketplace
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2016-06-29 15:36:54,900 http-nio-8080-exec-8 ERROR jgibbons 936x230x1 1hki7mv 10.10.21.19,10.68.179.129 /rest/supportHealthCheck/1.0/checkDetails [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
java.util.concurrent.CancellationException
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:121)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.getHealthCheckStatus(DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.access$000(DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager$1.apply(DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.java:96)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager$1.apply(DefaultSupportHealthCheckManager.java:92)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists$TransformingRandomAccessList$1.transform(Lists.java:617)
	at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:48)
	at java.util.AbstractCollection.toArray(AbstractCollection.java:141)
...
2016-06-29 15:37:52,809 SupportHealthCheckThread-6 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.p.healthcheck.support.EOLSupportHealthCheck] An error occurred when performing the EOL check, see the exceptions for more info
org.apache.http.conn.ConnectTimeoutException: Connect to marketplace.atlassian.com:443 [marketplace.atlassian.com/131.103.28.7] failed: Connection timed out

{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Create _<JIRA_HOME>_/{{jira-healthcheck-eol.json}} with example content. This file is located in the {{/var/atlassian/application-data/jira}} folder by default on a linux system.
{code:java|title=example from 7.2.0 release}
{"versions":[{"name":"7.2.0","releaseDate":"2016-08-24"},{"name":"7.1.0","releaseDate":"2016-02-10"},{"name":"7.0.0","releaseDate":"2015-09-25"}]}
{code}

A similar file exists for _<CONFLUENCE_HOME>_/{{shared-home/confluence-healthcheck-eol.json}}, see [CONFSERVER-45506|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-45506]

h3. Notes

The bug occurs in environments that utilize outbound proxy, whereby, even when configuration are done correctly (adding marketplace to the non proxy host config), and connection towards Marketplace is possible (add-ons and UPM works fine), the healthcheck plugin still throws {{Connect to marketplace.atlassian.com:443 [marketplace.atlassian.com/131.103.28.7] failed: Connection timed out}}.

The root cause is the connection is not made to the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/] with the system proxy settings, so it fails.

{panel:title=UPDATE| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5}
This has been fixed in JIRA Instance Health 2.1.20, which can be downloaded from the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin/server/overview] or updated through *Manage Add-ons*. The fix now takes into account system settings such as proxies.

To clarify, there are two separate bugs for fixing the End of Life health check:
# Proxies were not originally taken into account when accessing the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/], which is fixed in this bug, [JRASERVER-61781|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61781].
# If the {{jira-healthcheck-eol.json}} is not available, the check is unable to verify the results. This is tracked in [JRASERVER-63567|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63567].
{panel}
fields.summary: End-of-Life health check fails when using a proxy with Jira

  {panel}

h3. Summary 

The default priority icons on new projects are not accessible for red-green colour blind users.

The icons used for priority are green, orange and red, with no shape to distinguish them for a colour blind user.
The "medium", "high" and "highest" icons look the same to me from a normal viewing distance, and I need to get close to the screen to tell them apart (I'm colour deficient, the 12% of all men type). 

The "low" and "lowest" icons look the same colour, but they are at least pointing down.

On other types of projects, they have either a double arrow head, or a dotted "stem" so that the colour is not the only indication of priority.

h3. Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Business ==> Project Management type project. (or a Software project)
2. Create a "Task" issue.
3. Notice the priority icon and the available options for it by clicking on the field in the view issue page.

h3. Expected Results.

It's possible to distinguish all priority options without relying on their colour as an indication.

h3. Actual Results

It's not possible to distinguish all priority options without relying on their colour as an indication.

h3. Workaround

Configure a different set of icons for each new project affected by this bug.
fields.summary: Priority icons on new projects are not accessible for red-green colour blind users

h2. Summary
API endpoint {{rest/api/2/user}} does not allow searching by email address, only username.

My test user is an admin with Global Permission "Browse Users". I have tested directly with {{curl}}, a web browser, and the {{jira-ruby}} gem.

The documentation says finding by email address should work:

https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/user-findUsers

h2. Environment
Latest JIRA Cloud

h2. Steps to Reproduce
1. Using a user with Global Permission "Browse Users"
2. Query by username {{https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?username=fred}}
3. Query by email address {{https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?username=fred%40example.com}}

h2. Expected Results
Both queries should return the same user object.

h2. Actual Results
The first query works, the second query returns an error:
{code}
{"errorMessages":["The user named 'fred@example.com' does not exist"],"errors":{}}
{code}

h2. Workaround
None

h2. Similar Reports
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/243603/jira-rest-api-find-jira-user-based-on-users-email-address
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/174117/restapi2usersearch-not-returning-user
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60328
fields.summary: Unable to query REST API for user by email address

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attemping to move issues between projects the screen to choose the project does not show the project names in the project drop down, instead it shows the project ID's. 

 !2016-07-01_1434.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In source project, ensure that 'create issue' does not have any users or groups assigned to it or that you are not a member of those groups
# Choose an issue from the source project to move to another project, click move issue.
# Note on next screen that instead of displaying a list of projects to move to, it displays the project ID.


h3. Expected Results
The project names are displayed in the pick list or an error is thrown to note why you cannot move the issue.

h3. Actual Results
Project ID's show in the list. You can still choose a new issue type but when you click next you receive an error of 'the issue type selected is invalid' even though it is not.

There are no errors thrown in the log files
The following error is thrown in the browser developer console:
{noformat}
Javacript error:
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of undefined
batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:948 Uncaught
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The root cause is a permissions issue on the source project.  You should not need create issue permission on the source as you will be moving to a different project.  The pick list for project appears to error out when trying to generate the list because of the lack of permissions.

h3.Workaround


Add relevant users or groups to the 'create issue' permission for the source project you are moving from.
fields.summary: Project ID shows in drop down when moving issue between projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA performance degrades significantly during full and incremental directory sync. CPU spiking to 100%, page load delay between .5 - 5 min.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.0 or later
 * JIRA configured with AD LDAP directory (type Connected)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce*

1) Configure Microsoft AD in jira 7.1.4, make sure AD has enough users ie. 10k users
 2) Import few users 
 3) Login to jira as local user and be on directory page
 4) Configure jmeter "http" sessions using one of the AD user, session should repeat contentiously for 30 minute
 5) Initiate 20 concurrent sessions from jmeter --e.g browsing boards , issues etc.
 6) After 10 second of jemeter sessions initiate LDAP sync
 7) Login to jira on another browser and keep navigating pages, after 3-8 minute you will notice slowness and LDAP sync is running forever.
h3. Expected Results

Directory sync should happen without having performance degradation.
h3. Actual Result

JIRA performance significantly degrades when full and incremental sync is happening.
h3. Verification

To verify if the instance is affected by this bug, collect thread dumps during slow performance as per [Generate a Thread Dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Generating+a+Thread+Dump] - reviewing them the Caesium thread will contain the below thread over several thread dumps:
{noformat}
"Caesium-1-3" #189 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f2eae212000 nid=0x3540 waiting on condition [0x00007f2f1cff9000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000543279b50> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$FairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$WriteLock.lock(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:943)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.removeAll(DelegatingCache.java:256)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.clearUserCounts(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:632)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.onUserDeleted(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:529)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor2429.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1$1.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:48)
	at com.google.common.util.concurrent.MoreExecutors$DirectExecutorService.execute(MoreExecutors.java:299)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.dispatch(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.invokeListeners(EventPublisherImpl.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.publish(EventPublisherImpl.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.publishEvent(DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.java:1062)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.deleteCachedUsersByName(DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.java:318)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.deleteCachedUsersByGuid(DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.deleteCachedUsersByGuid(DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseUserChangesGuid(UsnChangedCacheRefresher.java:356)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseUserChanges(UsnChangedCacheRefresher.java:381)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseChanges(UsnChangedCacheRefresher.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:1097)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.JiraDirectorySynchroniser.synchronizeDirectory(JiraDirectorySynchroniser.java:77)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.JiraDirectorySynchroniser.runJob(JiraDirectorySynchroniser.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.launchJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:401)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:396)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeQueuedJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:349)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:255)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeNextJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:34)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
And there will be a number of Tomcat worker threads waiting on futures inside that cache (as per the attached screenshot). Essentially the sync is invalidating a cache that a large number of actions rely on and when it's invalidated those threads will block until it's repopulated.
h3. Workaround 

(If using Active Directory)
 # Set the [JIRA system property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-802593108.html]:
{noformat}
-Dcrowd.use.legacy.ad.incremental.sync=true
{noformat}

This workaround will mean that users who no longer exist in AD but own content in JIRA will not be deleted from the cache on an INCREMENTAL sync only, thus not triggering this issue. A FULL sync will still be affected, however.
h3. Note on partial fix:

We significantly reduced the performance problem by resolving issue --JRA-62742--, which was about skipping active user counting in cases when it was not required.

After gathering feedback we decided to reopen this issue to look further into how can we improve user synchronisation performance.
fields.summary: JIRA performance degradation during directory sync

h3. Description
Customer have a CSV file and contains a description filed. The value of the description file is formatted to have line break between lines. When customer import the CSV file and tick the Map field value option, JIRA will remove the line break between lines and import. 

h3. Step to reproduce
# Create a CSV file and add a description column.
# Enter multiple sentence and line break between the sentence for description field
!image-2016-07-01-20-51-47-221.png|thumbnail! 
# Login to JIRA
# Go to External Import System
# Upload the CSV file
# Proceed to Map fields page
# Tick *Map field value* for description field and click next
!image-2016-07-01-20-51-09-513.png|thumbnail! 
# JIRA show the description value without any space between lines
!image-2016-07-01-20-50-47-426.png|thumbnail!
# Click Begin Import
# Check the imported issue and found out the line break between sentence is removed.
!image-2016-07-01-20-52-39-458.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3. Expected Result
JIRA should not remove the line breaks and space between paragraph and sentences when import.
!image-2016-07-01-20-53-00-490.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Do not tick the *Map field value* option in Map value page
fields.summary: CSV import do not create line break for text field when user tick the Map field value option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61754].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you try to search a word which contains a forward slash with a wildcard, Lucene is not able to find that word.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with description = "RD/EE"
# Use the following JQL to search for that issue will work: {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/EE"{color}}} 
# If now change to use a JQL with a wildcard {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/E?"{color}}} or {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/E*"{color}}}, the issue is not found.

h3. Expected Results
Issue is in the result set of the JQL {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/E?"{color}}} or {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/E*"{color}}}

h3. Actual Results
Issue not found
 
h3. Notes
As suggested in [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-ReservedCharacters] I've used double back slash to escape the forward slash, but JQL {noformat}description ~ "RD\\/E?"{noformat} is still not working

h3.Workaround
Replace forward slash with a white space seems to work
fields.summary: Forward slash + wildcard causes JQL incorrect search result

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61753].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , for Application Link , user only can send *GET* and *DELETE* request . But , *POST* is not available to create application link.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide *POST* function for creating Application Link

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can use the unofficial endpoint discussed in the following thread in the [Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/] (it works for both, Server and Cloud): [Jira cloud addon: use API to create oauth1 application link|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Jira-cloud-addon-use-API-to-create-oauth1-application-link/qaq-p/1134043#M50814]


- *Endpoint:* 
{noformat}
https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/applinks/1.0/applicationlinkForm/createAppLink
{noformat}


 
- *Request Body:* 
{noformat}
{
"applicationLink": {
"typeId": "generic",
"name": "myapp",
"displayUrl": "http://example.com",
"rpcUrl": "http://example.com",
"isPrimary": false,
"isSystem": true
},
"username": "admin",
"password": "admin",
"customRpcURL": false,
"rpcUrl": "",
"createTwoWayLink": false,
"configFormValues": {
"trustEachOther": false,
"shareUserbase": false
}
}
{noformat}
 

- *Response Body:*
{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<createdApplicationLink>
<applicationLink>
<link href="https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/applinks/latest/applicationlink/a9b9f043-36ce-3181-a08e-774e01113b31" rel="self"/>
<id>a9b9f043-36ce-3181-a08e-774e01113b31</id>
<typeId>generic</typeId>
<name>myapp</name>
<displayUrl>http://example.com</displayUrl>
<iconUrl>https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/s/-w84psc/b/11/14089203f537b6cb29f73c5809f577b4a6a0c922/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:applinks-images/images/types/16generic.png</iconUrl>
<iconUri>https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/s/-w84psc/b/11/14089203f537b6cb29f73c5809f577b4a6a0c922/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:applinks-images/images/config/logos/128x128/128generic.png</iconUri>
<rpcUrl>http://example.com</rpcUrl>
<isPrimary>false</isPrimary>
<isSystem>false</isSystem>
</applicationLink>
<autoConfigurationSuccessful>true</autoConfigurationSuccessful>
</createdApplicationLink>
{noformat}
 

Please notice that this is just a workaround: the endpoint is not officially documented and it may change without prior notice. Please review the thread for further details.
fields.summary: REST API to Create Application Link

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The changes made in 'Project Email Address' does not take effect although it is configured as per the [Configuring a project's email address|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-email-notifications-802592925.html#Configuringemailnotifications-emailaddressConfiguringaproject'semailaddress] documentation

h3. Environment
JIRA with Outgoing Mail Server configured

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an Outgoing Mail Server for JIRA
# Trigger a notification and note the 'from' address in the inbox
# Edit the project email address in {{Project Administration >> Notifications}}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61746].
  {panel}

h2. Overview

Simply put, the Fix Versions field is contentious and sought after, specifically on a Scrum Board as a third tier hierarchy for things like:

- Good packaging and release management (ever accelerating with CI)
- Tracking the release of an overall product
- Tracking the progress of a milestone
- Tracking a mega-epic
- Tracking related work between two teams in the same project when their epics might be too focused

The Version Report in the Scrum Board is simply too good to only have teams make logical groupings of code releases with, especially as releases happen in smaller and smaller chunks as teams migrate to CI.

It is known that an issue can have multiple fix versions, but the Scrum Boards do not support this well (single version enforcement on drag and drop) and the push to use these strategically is doubling up on the desired usage of this field.

I run into this conflict over and over! It's such a useful field, and I'm hoping to have more ways to extend the grouping and reporting without that conflict.

h2. My Request (happy to chat about it):

- Please keep fix versions as the are today, with reporting intact.
- Introduce a new field (perhaps "Milestones") with similar:
-- Interactions on the Scrum Board (drag and drop)
-- Parameters for Start / End Dates
-- Reporting similar to that of fix versions
- Option on the Scrum Board to either show Fix Versions or Milestones as the primary drag and drop bucket (labs?).  The other would just be an editable field per issue, to not bloat the interface.
fields.summary: Segment Fix Versions from Strategic Objectives on Scrum Boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61743].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When changing a issue's issue type, the current way is to perform a *Move* operation, which as per documentation on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Moving+an+issue, the *Create Issue* permission is needed on the target project to complete this action. However, this also applies to issues that are not being moved from one project to another, where only the issue type is being changed but not the project.

h3. Suggested Solution

Remove the need that the user must have the *Create Issue* permission when using the *Move* action to simply change the issue type, but keeping the issue on the exact same project.
fields.summary: Allow user to change issue type without Create Issue permission

Whenever I try to mention someone whos name starts with "p", it says their are no results and I have to search for someone in another way. See screenshots - When I try to look for Pushkar by typing P, it says no results. But when I use his last name, he shows up.

*edit* This is bad for Pushkar, but worse for our colleague Patrick Peterson, who you can't even go last name. The workaround is to search for anyone else and then research, and it comes back (even when you start with p)

fields.description:
When I'm using the bulleting formatting and go to tag someone on my team in a bullet, JIRA automatically makes a new bullet for me, even though I'm in the middle of a sentence.

e.g. if I type

* Ask @JaneDoe to follow-up

After I finish the @ mention, it adds another line

I can take a screen-video if that's helpful.
fields.summary: Using an @mention in a bulleted list automatically makes a new line

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61739].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When creating a [XML Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/backing-up-data-185729581.html#BackingUpData-UsingJIRA%27sXMLbackuputility] on JIRA it is not needed to inform the format of the file, as it is done automatically. When restoring a backup, it is required to add the file format (.zip) to begin importing.

h3. Suggested Solution

If the user does not inform the format, the importer should try importing filename.zip automatically.
fields.summary: Restore backup without informing the file's format
JIRA Cloud support for markdown
